message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Current Ratio using the End numbers from the balance sheet.
• Total Current Assets (end) = 20,796,970.06 
• Total Current Liabilities (end) = 1,903,121.89 
Current Ratio = 20,796,970.06 / 1,903,121.89 ≈ 10.93

Step 2. Calculate the Gross Profit Margin using the income statement.
• Gross Profit = 4,962,437.45 
• Total Revenue = 18,062,437.45 
Gross Profit Margin = (4,962,437.45 / 18,062,437.45) × 100 ≈ 27.47%

Step 3. Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
• Total Liabilities can be derived as: Total Assets – Total Owner’s Equity = 31,154,033.87 – 29,250,911.98 = 1,903,121.89 
• Total Assets (end) = 31,154,033.87 
Debt to Asset Ratio = 1,903,121.89 / 31,154,033.87 ≈ 0.06

Step 4. Calculate the Net Profit Margin.
• Net Profit = 1,250,911.98 
• Total Revenue = 18,062,437.45 
Net Profit Margin = (1,250,911.98 / 18,062,437.45) × 100 ≈ 6.93%

Step 5. Calculate the Cash to Current Debt Ratio.
• Cash and Cash Equivalents ending balance from the cash flow statement = 4,145,577.58 
• Current Liabilities = 1,903,121.89 
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = 4,145,577.58 / 1,903,121.89 ≈ 2.18

Step 6. Calculate the Free Cash Flow (FCF).
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –13,358,400.82 
• Purchase of Fixed Assets (Capital Expenditure) = 2,496,021.60 
FCF = –13,358,400.82 – 2,496,021.60 = –15,854,422.42

Step 7. Calculate the Return on Assets (ROA).
• Net Profit = 1,250,911.98 
• Total Assets (end) = 31,154,033.87 
ROA = (1,250,911.98 / 31,154,033.87) × 100 ≈ 4.02%

Now presenting the solution in the required json format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "10.93",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "27.47%",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.06",
    "Net Profit Margin": "6.93%",
    "Cash to Current Debt Ratio": "2.18",
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-15854422.42",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "4.02%"
  }
}
